intro: Marcgravia evenia subsp. calcicola, commonly known as the limestone heliconia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the Araceae family and is characterized by its striking, paddle-shaped leaves and vibrant, spadix-like inflorescences. The plant thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found growing on rocky or limestone substrates. Its botanical features include a sympodial growth habit and a fibrous root system adapted to nutrient-poor soils. The species is noted for its ecological importance in supporting local biodiversity and its ornamental value in horticulture.
